upliftFT.title: Junior Product Manager at Uplift
upliftFT.subtitle: October 2022 - June 2023
upliftFT.description: Revamped multiple cross-functional KYC processes in the application funnel enabling partner bank migration.;Managed the technical development and deployment of fraud controls, notably the first FraudML model.;Formalized key processes and architecture documentation, while highlighting areas for redesign across engineering and business domains.;Assisted engineering counterparts in managing cross-functional relationships, resources, sprint goals and resolving any blockers.

ffaiFT.title: Technical Product Manager at FutureFit AI
ffaiFT.subtitle: January 2024 - July 2025
ffaiFT.description: Developed a scalable and cost-effective localization framework enabling product-driven expansion into Quebec and Europe.;Architected abstract entity grouping with scoped permissions and dynamic associations to mirror complex workforce development ecosystems.;Managed the development and release of a lean R&D copilot integrating platform services with an LLM user chat interface.;Authored an enriched data dictionary comprising of attributes across services and databases, integral to technical discovery.

andreGattiRecommendation.recommendationDescription: "Sid was able to successfully deliver a very complex project utilizing his strong technical skills. He was very proactive in suggesting solutions while interacting with the different groups such as backend, product management and design, while taking full ownership of the project."

nathanAptRecommendation.recommendationDescription: "As an intern in the Product team at Uplift, Sid was able to take ownership of the modernization of our developer documentation. He successfully navigated ambiguity and collaborated cross-functionally with the Data Engineering, Data Analytics, Application Engineering, and Merchant Success teams to guide the creation of new documentation that was up-to-date with our functionality and product offering and also guided developers to integrate with Uplift. As a result, we saw improvements in the time-to-onboard and data quality from partners as well as operational efficiencies in our internal processes."

kellyWengertRecommendation.recommendationDescription: "Sid always asked thoughtful questions. He cared about the quality of the experience and would pro-actively seek me out for my thoughts as he progressed. I'm excited for future designers to work with Sid as he demonstrates the joy and power of a collaborative developer/designer relationship."

aaronStuartRecommendation.recommendationDescription: "Siddharth did exceptional work and was a pleasure to work with for the time he was with us at TD Lab. He demonstrated both curiosity and drive with projects. He had equal interest and aptitude in the technical and business aspects of the work. He's a quick learner and I recommend him as top talent."

andrewKalymonRecommendation.recommendationDescription: "I had the pleasure of working with Sid for over a year on several projects, and I was consistently impressed by his abilities. Sid quickly proved himself to be a strong technical project manager, excelling in breaking down tasks with clear, concise ticket definitions that significantly improved our team’s workflow. His ability to dive into technical discussions and understand the details was a standout quality. Sid shows great potential and has a bright future ahead of him."

mikeCRecommendation.recommendationDescription: "Sid was an intern at Tile during early 2020. He was given the opportunity to take ownership of a full iOS feature that engages customers to activate and maintain a subscription to the services offered by Tile Inc. In addition, he worked on experiments to identify the performance of the App establishing a baseline. Sid was an exceptional intern. He embraced the technology, the team and our development process. He is articulate and able to coordinate across multiple teams. Sid has a friendly disposition and was an awesome team player."

me.description:
I am currently a 4th year student pursuing a dual degree in Computer Science and Business at the University of Waterloo and Wilfrid Laurier University respectively.

At my previous internships, I was given the opportunity to explore the field of mobile and backend development in a collaborative and fast paced environment. These opportunities have allowed me to refine my leadership and technical skills while working on a product currently in market.

As a software engineer, I am constantly looking for new challenges to push me outside my comfort zone, as I believe that we stop growing once we are unwilling to have new experiences.

Outside of school and work, I love exploring new cities, going on unplanned adventures, watching soccer and trying new food. Feel free to send me a message and say hi :)
